title: [K-12] Developing Argumentation Skills for Social Science Debates: A Socio-Cognitive-Emotional Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic social science concepts and logical reasoning experience
context.additional_context: Asynchronous content optimized for smartphone-based learning environments. Emphasizes practical learning through real-world social debate cases

learning_goals: Learners can recognize opposing perspectives in various social debates and analyze the rationale behind each position.
Students can write structured argumentative essays on social issues where scientific facts and value judgments are intertwined (e.g., vaccine controversy)
Students can separate emotional responses from cognitive judgments to develop objective argumentation strategies

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
